ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English envious, from Old French envïous, from Latin invidiōsus (full of envy), from invidia (envy).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Feeling or showing a desire to have a quality, possession, or other attribute belonging to someone else.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 嫉妒的；羡慕的；充满妒忌心的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I was very envious of his luxurious new car.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我非常羡慕他那辆豪华的新车。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Characterized by, expressing, or caused by envy.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 带有嫉妒色彩的；表现出嫉妒的（常用于描述行为、眼神或态度）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She gave him an envious look when he mentioned his promotion.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 当他提到自己升职时，她投给他一个充满嫉妒的眼神。
